Others: The Golden State Warriors were without several key players due to injuries and absences.
Dennis Schroder, Lindy Waters III, Buddy Hield, Kyle Anderson, and Trayce Jackson-Davis started for the Warriors.
Quinten Post was activated as a 10th player and Gui Santos and Pat Spencer were involved in the game plan.

Steph Curry and Draymond Green sat out, Andrew Wiggins is away for personal reasons, Jonathan Kuminga is out with an ankle sprain, Brandin Podziemski is dealing with an abdominal strain and Gary Payton II is recovering from a calf strain.
The Warriors hung around for three quarters before getting run off the floor in the fourth quarter.
Admirable effort alone wasn't enough for Golden State in the 108-96 loss.
Trayse Haliburton, Pascal Siakam, and Myles Turner led the Indiana Pacers with strong performances.
Spencer impressed with a career-high 17 points off the bench, and Hield matched him.
Gui Santos provided a lift off the bench with 11 points, three steals, and three assists in 23 minutes.
The Warriors are back at.500 after splitting the first half of their four-game road trip.
